intro: Cnemidaria contigua, commonly known as the common green alga, is a species of green algae belonging to the family Ulvaceae. It is characterized by its filamentous structure, with thalli that can be either branched or unbranched. This plant typically grows in marine and brackish water environments, often forming dense mats on rocky substrates. Its cellular structure includes chloroplasts containing chlorophyll a and b, enabling photosynthesis. Cnemidaria contigua plays a vital role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
